data.title: Athletic Facilities
data.text:
Finis Horne Arena

320 Stanley Ave., Greenwood, SC

Finis Horne Arena is home to the Lander basketball, volleyball and wrestling programs. Named after former men's basketball coach and athletic director Finis Horne, the arena opened in 1993 and seats 2,276 fans. Finis Horne Arena is also home to Lander's commencement exercises in the winter and spring.

Joe V. Chandler PEES Center

320 Stanley Ave., Greenwood, SC

Known as PEES to many Lander students, the Joe V. Chandler Center is the campus hub for all indoor recreation. The facility offers a student fitness center, a gym with 3 full-size basketball courts, an indoor walking track, racquetball courts and an aerobics/dance studio.

In order to use the Joe V. Chandler Center for recreational purposes, ALL Patrons must have a Valid Lander I.D. Card

Chandler Center Policies & Procedures Manual (PDF)

Stephen B. Dolny Stadium

Montague Ave., Greenwood, SC

Dolny Stadium is home to the Lander baseball program. The stadium opened in 2012 and is named for longtime Lander supporter and Greenwood businessman, Stephen B. Dolny. Seating 750 fans, Dolny Stadium hosted the 2013 Peach Belt Conference Tournament and the 2014 NCAA Southeast Regional. The facility is located in the Jeff May sports complex.

Joe Cabri Tennis Center

Montague Ave., Greenwood, SC

The Joe Cabri Tennis Center opened in 2012 and houses the Lander tennis programs. The facility is named for legendary former men's tennis coach Joe Cabri, a member of the South Carolina, Peach Belt Conference and Lander Halls of Fame. The center hosted the 2012 Peach Belt Conference Tournament and the NCAA Southeast Regionals in 2015 and 2018. The facility is located in the Jeff May sports complex.

Van Taylor Stadium

Montague Ave., Greenwood, SC

Van Taylor Stadium is home to the Lander soccer programs and is named for former men's soccer coach, Van Taylor. The venue, which seats 450 fans, opened in 2011 and has hosted Peach Belt Conference Tournament and NCAA Tournament matches. The facility is located in the Jeff May sports complex.

Lander Wrestling Center

Montague Ave., Greenwood, SC

In 2021 Lander wrestling moved into its new state of the art wrestling complex. The new facility includes 2 Â½ full mats, wall to wall padding, as well as a strength and conditioning area inside the wrestling room. The practice room is also outfitted with state of the art Audio and video equipment. Additionally, the new complex includes a state of the art weight room, new locker rooms and showers, team room, and coaches offices. The facility is located in the Jeff May sports complex.

The Equestrian Center

2611 Hwy. 72-221 East, Greenwood, SC

The 37-acre facility, located on the campus of Burton Center in Greenwood, houses the Therapeutic Riding Program and serves as the home base for the university's Equestrian Team. The center also serves as a dynamic learning environment for equine-related academic opportunities within Lander's Therapeutic Horsemanship minor.

ADA / Accessibility

Accessible Parking

There are designated handicapped parking at all Lander athletic facilities including parking at Horne Arena, The Jeff May Complex and parking to accesses the Doug Spears softball field, Dolny Baseball Stadium and Van Taylor Soccer/Lacrosse Stadium

Accessible Seating

The following facilities have accessible seating zones.

Van Taylor Stadium

Doug Spears Field

Dolny Stadium

Horne Arena

Facility Accessibility

All athletic facilities at Lander University have accessible ramps to use to enter and exit the facilities.

All athletic facilities at Lander University are tobacco free. Pets and outside food are not allowed at any Lander athletic event.
